para: HSVAColor specifies a in terms of its hue, saturation, value and opacity (alpha). We stole our algorithm for converting between RGB and HSV from .
hue is angle on the color wheel, in degrees. 0 or 360 is red, 60 is yellow, 120 is green, 180 is cyan, 240 is blue, and 300 is magenta.
saturation describes the strength or purity of the color. It's a floating point number between 0 and 1. Low values give pale, washed-out colors, tending toward white.
value is the brightness of the color. It too is a floating point number between 0 and 1, where 0 is darkest and 1 is brightest.
alpha is the opacity of the color. It is a floating point number between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is completely opaque.
